discussion.content:
Tables (classes) that extend the Asset table, taken straight from sys_db_object.list:

- Consumable
- Enterprise asset
- Enterprise Software Asset
- Facility
- Hardware
- Software License

Selected Answer: ABDEG
ABDEG Is Correct
The default asset classes are Hardware, Software License, Consumable, Bundle, Software Entitlement, and Facility. These general classes can be used to manage various assets.

Selected Answer: ABDEG
Answer:
 A. Hardware assets
 B. Facility assets
 D. Software licenses assets
 E. Enterprise Software assets
 G. Consumables assets

Explanation: "The default asset classes are Hardware, Software License, Consumable, Bundle, Software Entitlement, and Facility."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/sandiego-it-service-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/c_AssetClasses.html

questions.question_text: Asset classes are defined to allow for logical grouping of assets. There are five asset classes provided to group assets, each Asset class provides unique functionality for that group of Assets in the platform. Which of the following are the asset classes used? (Choose five.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This should be correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

C should be the right answer. Because in CSM there is no table named as Product Model and even Asset table does not belong to ITSM instead it belongs to ITAM. So, CSM and ITSM uses the same Asset table but CSM Asset have one field which is Asset class.
This question was on the exam

choices.B: CSM uses the Product Model table instead of the ITSM Asset table
choices.D: Because CSM Assets are managed differently from ITSM Assets ServiceNow uses different Asset Tables for CSM than it does for ITSM
choices.A: CSM uses the Product table instead of the ITSM Asset table
choices.C: ServiceNow uses the same Asset table for both CSM and ITSM, however CSM has a different subset of fields

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes how the CSM application uses the Asset table?

discussion.content: Easy to remember. Awaiting info is only used in D. an CSM doesnt has "on Hold"

Selected Answer: D
D is Correct.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/r_CustomerServiceCaseStates.html

Selected Answer: D
ans is D

Selected Answer: D
d is correct

choices.D: New > Open > Awaiting Info > Open > Resolved > Closed
choices.A: New > Work in Progress > On Hold > Work in Progress > Resolved > Closed
choices.B: New > Open > Work in Progress > Solution Proposed > Closed
choices.C: Open > Pending > Work in Progress > Resolved > Closed

questions.question_text: A consumer service agent receives and accepts a case which was created by a consumer. The agent needs and requests more information from the consumer. After receiving the information, the agent proposes a solution that is accepted by the consumer. Given this scenario, what is the chronological order of case states used to manage this case?
What are the types of matching criteria for Customer Service? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABEF
ABEF is Correct

Selected Answer: ABEF
ABEF is Correct

Selected Answer: ABEF
Answer:
 A. Matching Skills
 B. Last Assigned
 E. Assigned Cases
 F. Availability Today

Explanation: matching criteria:
 - Availability Today
 - Matching Skills
 - Matching Skills - Mandatory Skills Support
 - Assigned Cases
 - Last Assigned

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/sandiego-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/case-assignment-matching-criteria.html

questions.question_text: What is a supported external customer that, in turn, sells to and supports one or more customers?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A partner is a supported external customer that, in turn, sells to and supports one or more customers. A partner account record stores information about a partner's company, similar to a customer account. On a partner account record, the Partner field is enabled. A partner can report and manage cases on behalf of customers. A partner can also be a customer.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer
A partner is a supported external customer that, in turn, sells to and supports one or more customers.
